dlgLine.text: I don't know the best way to announce this... but early this morning, there was a murder.
Mia's body was found in the bathroom.
Jenifer's body was found in the bathroom.
Lane's body was found in the bathroom.
From talking to others here, we have the following details about the events leading up to and after the murder.
It was dark - someone saw what they believe was a man wandering around the hallway around the likely time of the murder.
The victim's skull was caved in within a single blow - this indicates that the assailant was stronger than average.
The following people were unaccounted for during the time the murder occurred. We've collected statements from them - I will play them back for you.
I was out smoking a cigarette when it happened. I know you have to be thorough, but really, You think I would do something like that?
ME?! On my honor, I would never harm an innocent! I was on the rampart, scanning the darkness for foes.
Unless they were already dead, I didn't do it. I was sleeping - away from everyone else, like I always do. Are we done?
What the hell you asking me for? You think I did it?! I mean, yeah, maybe I didn't get along with 'em, but does that make me guilty? No. I know my rights!
I heard someone run down the hallway last night - I'm sorry, I should have checked it out, but I was tired and obviously, I didn't think it would turn out to be something like this.

Oh, c'mon... You think if someone as smart as me did it that I would've made it look like a murder? And as for where I was... that's... I refuse to answer because that's for me to know and for none of you to have business with - I mean, none of your business!
So... We have accounts from witnesses and we have statements from the suspects. From the evidence and testimonies - who should we call in for sentencing?
Mark Corbeau - you have been accused of the crime of murder. Before we get to sentencing, do you have anything you want to say?
I didn't do this... You know I didn't do this... You're making a mistake. I don't have an alibi and you're just looking for someone to blame. So let's get this over with...
Sir Charleston - you have been accused of the crime of murder. Before we get to sentencing, do you have anything you want to say?
Good people, I am not a murderer! Yes... Yes, there are certain things I can't remember lately - things that confuse me and make me doubt myself - but I know in my heart, I could not do this!
Max Getz - you have been accused of the crime of murder. Before we get to sentencing, do you have anything you want to say?

The things I've done lately... I'm guilty of a lot of crimes. Yes, sometimes I lose control... For some of you, I was guilty of murder the day you met me. Well... here's your chance to judge me. Get on with it.
Troy Cooper - you have been accused of the crime of murder. Before we get to sentencing, do you have anything you want to say?

Y'all want to pin this on me?! You think of all the people I might kill here, that'd be the one?! Not that I'm saying I'd kill someone - thought about it - but I didn't do it! But, you give me a hammer right now and I'd knock all your damn heads off!
Grant White - you have been accused of the crime of murder. Before we get to sentencing, do you have anything you want to say?

I'm not going to try to lie and get out of this. You know why? Because I DID do it. I did it for this place, because there are some people here who are parasites - individuals with no skills and no worth. They're eating our food and holding us real survivors back. Are we really worse off for their loss? No.
Doug Schultz - you have been accused of the crime of murder. Before we get to sentencing, do you have anything you want to say?
What? Me? You can't prove it was me! You're just blaming me because you don't like me! I bet it was one of you that did it! I... I... I want a lawyer!
We have to decide a punishment for the guilty party. Please weigh this carefully - this is a serious crime and we will have to convince people that the school is still safe.
Well, the usual sentence for murder in Texas is the death penalty. But seeing as we don't have the means or resources to conduct a fair trial, I say we imprison them.
<To you> I'm willing to back what you think's fair.
I think they should have to live with their crime. That's real punishment.
What they did was wrong. However, I don't feel like we need anymore death here. They should be exiled.
<To you> But I'll accept any punishment you think is fair.
Keeping them here is just going to remind people of the murder. Better we kick them out now.
We should forget about it. We need all the warm bodies we can get. We've already lost one person - why diminish our ranks even more?
<To you> It's up to you - I'll get behind whatever you decide.
I'm not saying we shouldn't punish them, but let them die working for us. Stick them with the suicide missions.
Kill 'em painfully - make an example out of them.
<To you> You got other ideas, I'm willing to hear them.
You want people to respect you, you need to make this right. End them - right in the yard, in front of everyone.
I believe God can forgive and that we should rehabilitate them in prison. Despite what some might say, that's the Christian thing to do.
<To you> Although, I understand that sometimes you have to do what the majority expects you to do, and I'm willing to back your decision, no matter what.
I think they can still be saved, and I'm willing to put in the time to rehabilitate the prisoner.

If an innocent person is killed, we have a responsibility to give people the justice they expect from us. I've always been a believer in the death penalty. If you murder someone in a society - which is what we have here - then you forfeit your right to life.
<To you> You know what I'd vote for. However, you have my support for whatever you decide.
An eye for an eye. It's what they would get in court, and it's what the people here will demand.
<To you> It's time to make a decision. How should we punish the accused?

dlgAnsw.text: Imprison them. They will receive limited food and be locked up for the rest of their time here.
They will be exiled from the shelter immediately.
The accused will be executed for their crime.
The accused will be allowed to stay - but they will work off their crime and take reduced rations for now on.
We ate yesterday, so today we go without. We will resume normal rations tomorrow.
We have too many mouths to feed. Leave it to me... I'll take care of our problem the more direct way.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to imprison the guilty party. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to exile the guilty party. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: Yes, that's my final decision. Remove them immediately.
Yes, that's my final decision. Remove them immediately.
Yes, that's my final decision. Remove them immediately.
Yes, that's my final decision. Remove them immediately.
Yes, that's my final decision. Remove them immediately.
Yes, that's my final decision. Remove them immediately.
On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: You're proposing immediate execution? Are you sure?

dlgAnsw.text: Yes, that's my final decision. Bring them out into the yard.
Yes, that's my final decision. Bring them out into the yard.
Yes, that's my final decision. Bring them out into the yard.
Yes, that's my final decision. Bring them out into the yard.
Yes, that's my final decision. Bring them out into the yard.
Yes, that's my final decision. Bring them out into the yard.
On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to grant the accused amnesty here, but they must work off their debt and suffer a penalty to their rations. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to cut food to the whole shelter for today in order to preserve more food for the future. It will be crucial that we find more food today. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The sentence is decided - the guilty party will be taken away and imprisoned.
I agree. It may not be convenient, but it's the right and just thing to do.
I agree. It may not be convenient, but it's the right and just thing to do.
I'm not sure this is the right thing to do, but I'll do what I can to help people understand your decision.
If we had a proper jail, maybe, but this isn't going to make anyone feel safer.
Eh... Okay, if that's how you want to do this...
Why bother? This is just a waste of food and time.
I'll back you on this... but for the record, I think it's a shitty idea.
So they can lay around and still eat our food?! For what he did, he deserves to be shot in the legs and left out for the corpses!
This is the righteous thing to do. I'm happy with this decision.
This is the righteous thing to do. I'm happy with this decision.
It's not my preference, obviously, but you seem to know what you're doing, so you have my support.
This is the worst thing we can do! You're telling people that murder will get you a nice, warm bed and a hot meal for doing nothing. They should pay for their crimes with their lives!
The accused will be exiled from the school immediately.
I'm not sure this is the best way to go about this, but I'll back you this time.
This isn't right. This is essentially a death sentence - just admit it.
We can't keep them here and another death under our roof will just make things worse. This is the best decision.
We can't keep them here and another death under our roof will just make things worse. This is the best decision.
I think there are better ways to handle this, but if that's how it's going down, I'll go along with it.
You should have made them work for us. Now we're down two pairs of hands and we'll all have to work harder because of it.
Okay, maybe they'll die out there, so I guess that's a plus.
Why? If they're going to buy it out there anyhow, why not just put bullet in them and give us all the satisfaction of watching them die?
I would have rather we handled this differently, but... I can support this.
I'm opposed to this. This is a death sentence that we don't have to watch.
I don't like this, but I'll support it because you've been fair in the past.
I don't like this. He needs to die for what he's done and the people here deserve the satisfaction of knowing he's paid for his crimes.
The sentence is death. The guilty party will be executed today.
I don't approve, but I'll back you on this... Just don't make this a regular thing.
This is too easy. They should have to live with their crimes - that's punishment, not this! Death's too good a fate these days.
...I really was hoping you would go another way, but I'll support you this time.
What does this really get us? Justice? Revenge? This is petty. People here don't need to deal with anymore death.
Kind of a waste, but... you're the boss.
A waste of resources. Might as well have them dig their own grave - at least we can get that last bit of work out of them.
Good. If you need an executioner, you let me know.
Good. If you need an executioner, you let me know.
I'm really not sure how I can justify this, but I'll try.
How will this make them atone for their sin? This is an unfortunate decision.
This is the right decision - the people will have justice.
This is the right decision - the people will have justice.
The accused will be allowed to remain here despite their crime. Their food will be rationed for the remainder of their days here.
...This is going to be a tough one to explain to the others, but I'll do what I can.
You're just going to give them a pardon? How can we trust this person anymore?
I'm not sure how to justify this... I'll try my best.
I understand the reasoning, but really, how do you think people are going to take this? It's not going to end well.
Good. When it comes down to it, half the people here are murderers. It's a skill we can use.
Good. When it comes down to it, half the people here are murderers. It's a skill we can use.
You know, you usually do right by me, and that's the only reason I'm going to let you get away with this one.
Living with that killer? You think I cold live with Marshall after what he did? You think anyone here's going to just accept that?!
I'm not sure this is the right way to handle this... but I'll do what I can to explain it.
While I'm all in favor of them working off their debt, I think the majority of the people here are going to disagree with this punishment.
...Well, let's just say I'm supporting you because most of the time you get it right.
This won't stand. No matter how desperate we are, no one's going to accept this man back into our society. I certainly can't.
The decision is to cut all food today, conserve resources for the future, and hopefully secure more food immediately.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
I'm really not happy about this, but I'll back you up because I have confidence you won't make this a weekly event.
No food today? And what happens if we're attacked or driven out of here? We'll be dead on our feet. <Shakes his head> You people...
Do I look like I diet? Still, I guess you've stuck your neck out for me before, so I can deal with it.
So let me get this straight - I don't eat and you'll probably make me do the heavy lifting out there? Well, why didn't you say we were having shit sandwiches for dinner?
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
The decision is to... find a way to reduce the population here at the shelter through whatever means necessary.
I... I really hope that you mean you're going to find a volunteer.
What the hell is this - the damn mafia? I swear on my goddamn life that if I hear you took someone behind a shed and put a bullet in them about this, I'm taking you down!
I have to believe you've got a better plan than just fragging the last person to piss you off. Right?
If you're going to turn this into a dictatorship, you better believe I will work with everyone else to depose you.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
If you're going to rule by fear, I say you have to draw a line somewhere, but on the other hand I'm fairly sure you won't pick me, so I'm willing to let it slide.
That sounds like something Marshall would do... And I'm sure as hell not going to stay if I have to live in fear of being on your shit list.
I hope this is just a misunderstanding... Based on our previous actions, I have to believe you're going to do the right thing.
I know that sometimes you have to kill because otherwise we all would be killed. But murder is a sin...
Well... I suppose you could always find someone who's unhappy and give them the option to leave...
No one is judge, jury, and executioner - this is madness! If this is how you intend to run the place, maybe it's time to elect a new leader!
I'd like to end this meeting with a moment of silence for the victim...
Thank you.
